properties.name: auth0.domain
properties.description: This is your auth0 domain (tenant you have created when registering with auth0 - account name).

properties.name: auth0.issuer
properties.description: This is the issuer of the JWT Token (typically full URL of your auth0 tenant account.

properties.name: auth0.enabled
properties.description: A boolean flag that can disable all Auth0 Spring Boot starters.  This is mostly useful during testing or debugging, or if you want to compare behavior when Auth0 is enabled or disabled.

properties.name: auth0.clientId
properties.description: This is the client id of your auth0 application (see Settings page on auth0 dashboard).

properties.name: auth0.clientSecret
properties.description: This is the client secret of your auth0 application (see Settings page on auth0 dashboard).

properties.name: auth0.onLogoutRedirectTo
properties.description: This is the page / view that users of your site are redirected to on logout. Should start with `/`.

properties.name: auth0.loginRedirectOnSuccess
properties.description: This is the landing page URL context path for a successful authentication. Should start with `/`.

properties.name: auth0.loginRedirectOnFail
properties.description: This is the URL context path for the page to redirect to upon failure. Should start with `/`.

properties.name: auth0.loginCallback
properties.description: This is the URL context path for the login callback endpoint. Should start with `/`.

properties.name: auth0.securedRoute
properties.description: This is the URL pattern to secure a URL endpoint. Should start with `/`.

properties.name: auth0.base64EncodedSecret
properties.description: This is a boolean value indicating whether the Secret used to verify the JWT is base64 encoded. Default is `true`.

properties.name: auth0.signingAlgorithm
properties.description: This is signing algorithm to verify signed JWT token. Use `HS256` or `RS256`.

properties.name: auth0.publicKeyPath
properties.description:
This is the path location to the public key stored locally on disk / inside your application War file WEB-INF directory.
Should always be set when using `RS256`.
Default to empty string as HS256 is default.
